definition: a full mouth of (sth physical)/to have the mouth exclusively filled with (a certain language, lies, promises, etc)/(to agree etc) unreservedly
mouth/classifier for things with mouths (people, domestic animals, cannons, wells etc)/classifier for bites or mouthfuls
mouth full of literary phrases/to spout the classics
pinyin: man3 kou3 zhi1 hu1 zhe3 ye3

sentences.english: Wang Xueming keen on the idea, so she came to Beijing to complete the procedure.
sentences.chinese: 王學明滿口答應，讓她來北京辦手續。

sentences.english: I readily promised, and say a person to walk not frightened.
sentences.chinese: 我滿口答應了，並說一個人走不害怕。

sentences.english: Not like the foul-mouthed bunch today.
sentences.chinese: 可不像現在那些滿口髒話的年輕人。

sentences.english: I was stunned by his remarks full of vile curses.
sentences.chinese: 他的滿口髒話令我齒冷。

sentences.english: He became abusive when he was drunk.
sentences.chinese: 他喝醉時就滿口髒話罵人了。

sentences.english: Xia Hongfang concerned about Exchange rate every day in the past, now full of pollution-free.
sentences.chinese: 夏紅芳過去每天關心匯率，而今滿口無公害。

sentences.english: In agreeing so readily, he had an axe to grind.
sentences.chinese: 他滿口答應了這件事，是有他自己的算盤的。

sentences.english: Their vocabulary bristles fashionably with talk of federalism.
sentences.chinese: 他們開口閉口都是聯邦制度，滿口時髦詞彙。

sentences.english: He was a philosopher, full of little sayings and homilies about the ways of the world.
sentences.chinese: 他是哲學家，滿口關於處世的要言妙道。

sentences.english: I would order my cause before him, and fill my mouth with arguments.
sentences.chinese: 我就在他面前將我的案件陳明，滿口辯白。

sentences.english: Of course even in 1884, everyone knew this was bunk.
sentences.chinese: 當然，即使在當時每個人都知道他在滿口胡言。

sentences.english: Foul-mouthed children should be severely punished.
sentences.chinese: 滿口髒話的孩子應該被嚴厲處罰。

sentences.english: I would order [my] cause before him, and fill my mouth with arguments.
sentences.chinese: 我就在他面前將我的案件陳明，滿口辯白。

sentences.english: After eating a few mouthfuls, put downyour knife and fork and just take a break.
sentences.chinese: 當滿口喫過幾次食物後，記得放下刀叉休息一下。

sentences.english: Avoid platitudes, such as â Time heals all wounds.â
sentences.chinese: 避免滿口的陳腔濫調，比如“時間會治癒一切的傷。”
